page.title: 10The Library and Reading
page.content: The new Deal Library opened on December 6th 1976. To obtain books it has a van come each Monday. The librarians look at the books, choose some and the van leaves on Wednesday. The library owns roughly 59,500 books, but a third should be on loan at any time. The most popular books are {detective/murder stories, romances}and mainly new books. The library obtains new books from bookshops in Kent. Most people use Deal Library a lot. A third of the people like the new computer system and a third dislike it. Some people wished there were still{mobile libraries}and very few grown-ups use a book club. A lot of people seem to enjoy a good read but don't read more than a book a week. Overall I think peoples' reading habits in Deal are very variable.
